item.title: 墨西哥部长表示美国将允许恢复进口墨西哥牛肉
item.description: 墨西哥农业部长周六在社交网站 X 上发文称，美国在签署谅解备忘录后将允许墨西哥恢复牛肉进口。【原文：The United States will permit the resumption of Mexican beef imports after it signed a memorandum of understanding to do so, Mexico's agriculture minister said in a post on social media site X on Saturday.】

item.title: 亿万富翁阿克曼将在内华达州重新组建管理公司
item.description: 投资公司潘兴广场（Pershing Square）的所有者比尔-阿克曼（Bill Ackman）周六表示，他将在内华达州重新注册他的管理公司。【原文：Bill Ackman, the owner of investment firm Pershing Square, said on Saturday that he is reincorporating his management company in Nevada.】

item.title: 英国《金融时报》报道：欧盟将要求特姆、Shein 和亚马逊为 "不安全 "商品承担责任
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周六报道，欧盟正计划让 Temu、Shein 和亚马逊市场等电子商务平台为网上销售的危险或非法产品承担责任。【原文：The European Union is planning to make e-commerce platforms such as Temu, Shein and Amazon Marketplace liable for dangerous or illegal products sold online, the Financial Times reported on Saturday.】

item.title: 洞察：两名前员工如何推动马里与巴里克的强硬谈判
item.description: 据熟悉谈判情况的人士称，两名了解巴里克黄金公司在西非运营情况的前公司高管正在帮助推动马里要求这家加拿大矿商支付约 2 亿美元。【原文：Two former company executives with inside knowledge of Barrick Gold's operations in West Africa are helping to drive Mali's demands for a payment of around $200 million from the Canadian miner, according to people familiar with the talks.】

item.title: 麦当劳与挑战拉丁裔奖学金计划的诉讼达成和解
item.description: 麦当劳表示，它将修改一项向拉丁裔和西班牙裔学生颁发奖学金的计划，取消任何基于申请人种族或族裔的资格标准，以解决一个反对平权法案的团体提起的诉讼。【原文：McDonald's said it will revise a program that awards scholarships to Latino and Hispanic students to eliminate any eligibility criteria based on applicants' race or ethnicity, to settle a lawsuit by a group opposed to affirmative action.】

item.title: 好市多与卡车司机谈判委员会达成临时协议
item.description: 卡车司机工会周六表示，其谈判委员会已与美国零售商好市多批发公司（Costco Wholesale）就新合同达成临时协议。【原文：The Teamsters labor union said on Saturday that its negotiating committee has reached a tentative agreement for a new contract with U.S. retailer Costco Wholesale .】

item.title: 印度财政预算案 印度削减部分智能手机零部件进口税，为苹果、小米等公司打气
item.description: 印度财政部长尼尔马拉-西塔拉曼（Nirmala Sitharaman）周六在年度预算中宣布，印度已取消对生产手机的一些关键部件征收进口关税，这将促进本地生产，并使苹果和小米等公司受益。【原文：India has removed import duties on some components key to producing mobile phones, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced in the annual budget on Saturday, in a boost for local production efforts and benefiting firms such as Apple and Xiaomi .】

item.title: 特朗普准备下令对墨西哥、加拿大和中国商品征收高额关税
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普预计将于周六签署一项命令，对来自墨西哥和加拿大的商品征收 25% 的高额新关税，对来自中国的进口商品征收 10% 的关税，这可能会扰乱价值超过 2.1 万亿美元的年度贸易。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump is expected to sign an order on Saturday imposing hefty new tariffs of 25% on goods from Mexico and Canada and 10% on imports from China, potentially disrupting more than $2.1 trillion worth of annual trade.】

item.title: 报告显示，1 月份中国房价和销量进一步下滑
item.description: 一家领先的房地产研究机构周六表示，1 月份中国新建住房销售量和现有住宅价格均继续下降。【原文：China's sales of new housing and prices for existing residential units both continued to decline in January, a leading real estate research institute said on Saturday.】

item.title: 中国市场监管部门称 "稳定信心 "是关键
item.description: 中国最高金融市场监管机构周六表示，"稳定市场、稳定信心、稳定预期 "是政府为领先技术提供更好资本准入的优先事项。【原文：China's top financial market regulator said on Saturday that "stabilising the market, stabilising confidence and stabilising expectations" were priorities as the government works to provide better access to capital for leading technology.】

item.title: 星巴克表示，公司和工会撤回了针对对方的诉讼
item.description: 星巴克及其代表 10,000 多名咖啡师的工会同意撤回对对方提起的诉讼，该公司称，此前一天双方同意引入一名调解员，以帮助恢复陷入僵局的谈判。【原文：Starbucks and its union representing over 10,000 baristas have agreed to withdraw lawsuits filed against each other, the company said, a day after the two sides agreed to bring in a mediator to help resume stalled negotiations.】

item.title: 华纳兄弟探索公司与专业投资者合作，共同拥有音乐版权组合
item.description: 华纳兄弟探索公司（Warner Bros Discovery）与媒体音乐版权投资和管理公司 Cutting Edge Group 周五表示，双方已成立一家合资企业，共同拥有这家娱乐工作室的电影和电视音乐目录。【原文：Warner Bros Discovery and Cutting Edge Group, an investor and manager of media music rights, have created a joint venture to co-own the entertainment studio's catalog of film and TV music, the companies said on Friday.】

item.title: 德克萨斯证券交易所申请在全国范围内运营，预计 2026 年初开始交易
item.description: 德克萨斯证券交易所（TXSE）的母公司周五表示，在提交了作为全国性证券交易所运营的文件后，该交易所有望于 2026 年推出。【原文：The Texas Stock Exchange (TXSE) is eyeing a 2026 launch after submitting paperwork to operate as a national securities exchange, its parent company said on Friday.】

item.title: 按公司分列的美国进口加拿大和墨西哥原油情况
item.description: 许多美国炼油厂在很大程度上依赖进口原油，因为它们的设备配置是为了运行较重的原油，如来自墨西哥和加拿大的原油。【原文：Many U.S. oil refiners rely heavily on imported crude because their facilities are configured to run heavier grades, such as those coming in from Mexico and Canada.】

item.title: 马斯克和共和党竞选团队的律师组建了新的华盛顿事务所
item.description: 亿万富翁特斯拉首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的政治行动委员会的一名律师正与两名律师一起成立一家新的律师事务所，这两名律师的客户包括共和党人美国众议院议长迈克-约翰逊（Mike Johnson）和曾经的总统候选人维韦克-拉马斯瓦米（Vivek Ramaswamy）。【原文：A lawyer for billionaire Tesla CEO Elon Musk's political action committee is launching a new law firm along with two attorneys whose clients include Republicans U.S. House Speaker Mike Johnson and one-time presidential candidate Vivek Ramaswamy.】

item.title: 独家消息：消息人士称ADM将很快裁员以削减成本
item.description: 三位知情人士周五告诉路透社，由于农作物价格低廉侵蚀了利润，作为全球削减成本努力的一部分，全球谷物商阿彻-丹尼尔斯-米德兰公司（Archer-Daniels-Midland）将很快开始裁员。【原文：Global grain merchant Archer-Daniels-Midland will soon start laying off employees as part of a global effort to cut costs as low crop prices erode profit, three people briefed on the matter told Reuters on Friday.】

item.title: 辉瑞解决了保守派对多元化奖学金计划的质疑
item.description: 辉瑞公司已经解决了一个保守派团体提起的诉讼，该团体指控辉瑞公司为促进黑人、拉丁裔和美国原住民担任公司领导职务而设立的奖学金计划对白人和亚裔申请者存在非法歧视。【原文：Pfizer has resolved a lawsuit by a conservative group that alleged that a fellowship program that the drugmaker established to boost the pipeline of Black, Latino and Native American people in leadership positions at the company unlawfully discriminated against white and Asian-American applicants.】

item.title: 特朗普的关税承诺令市场不安，但也留下了问题
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周五告诉记者，加拿大、墨西哥和中国无法采取任何措施来阻止关税的征收，并补充说计划对欧盟征收 "非常实质性的 "关税。【原文：President Donald Trump told reporters on Friday nothing can be done by Canada, Mexico and China to forestall tariffs, adding that something "very substantial" was planned for tariffs on the European Union.】

item.title: 总结 大石油公司看淡 2025 年炼油利润
item.description: 本周，雪佛龙、埃克森美孚和壳牌公布的第四季度财报显示，由于燃料生产利润下滑，炼油厂利润短期内难有改善。【原文：Big Oil executives this week saw little prospect of a near-term improvement in refinery profits after Chevron , Exxon Mobil and Shell all reported fourth-quarter earnings that were hit hard by a downturn in the margins for producing fuel.】

item.title: 美国政府可能要求 J&J 赔偿癌症治疗费用超过 10 亿美元
item.description: 一名政府律师周五表示，美国卫生及公共服务部可能会向强生公司索赔 10 亿多美元，以补偿联邦卫生机构为那些声称该公司生产的婴儿爽身粉和其他滑石粉产品导致其罹患癌症的患者支付的医疗费用。【原文：The U.S. Department of Health & Human Services may seek over $1 billion from Johnson & Johnson as reimbursement for federal health agencies' payments of medical costs for patients who allege that the company's baby powder and other talc products caused them to develop cancer, a government attorney said Friday.】

item.title: JM Smucker 剥离部分甜味烘焙食品品牌，专注于 Hostess 品牌
item.description: JM Smucker 周五表示，将以约 4000 万美元的价格向包装食品制造商 JTM Foods 出售其包装糕点品牌 Cloverhill 和肉桂卷品牌 Big Texas，因为该公司希望削减其甜味烘焙零食部门的成本。【原文：JM Smucker said on Friday it would sell its packaged pastries brand Cloverhill and cinnamon rolls label Big Texas to packaged food maker JTM Foods for about $40 million, as the company looks to cut costs in its sweet baked snacks segment.】

item.title: 特朗普称关税可能造成短期混乱
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周五承认，关税成本有时会转嫁给消费者，并表示他的关税征收计划可能会造成短期混乱。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday acknowledged that tariff costs are sometimes passed along to consumers, and said his plans to impose tariffs may cause a short-term disruption.】

item.title: 桑坦德银行任命莱利为桑坦德银行美国分行首席执行官，这是更广泛改组的一部分
item.description: 桑坦德银行执行主席安娜-博廷（Ana Botin）周五表示，克里斯蒂安娜-莱利（Christiana Riley）将接替蒂姆-温纳斯（Tim Wennes）担任桑坦德银行美国首席执行官，桑坦德银行正在进行更广泛的全球重组。【原文：Christiana Riley will succeed Tim Wennes as CEO of Santander in the United States, the bank's executive chair, Ana Botin, said on Friday, as Santander undertakes a wider global restructuring.】

item.title: 古巴与美国关系日益紧张，哈瓦那俱乐部仍保持朗姆酒畅销
item.description: 哈瓦那俱乐部（Havana Club）的高层管理人员本周表示，即使古巴的甘蔗收成跌至历史最低点，华盛顿与哈瓦那之间的紧张局势加剧，该公司仍将继续生产其著名的顺滑朗姆酒。【原文：Havana Club will keep churning out its famously smooth rum even as Cuba's sugar cane harvests plummet to historic lows and tensions ratchet up between Washington and Havana, the company's top executive said this week.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，Meta 正在商谈在得克萨斯州或其他州重新注册公司，退出特拉华州
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周五援引知情人士的话报道，Meta Platforms 正在讨论将公司注册地从特拉华州转移到德克萨斯州或其他州。【原文：Meta Platforms is discussing moving its incorporation from Delaware to Texas or other states, the Wall Street Journal reported on Friday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司裁员 4000 多人
item.description: 伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway）周五表示，尽管沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）经营的这家企业集团有望实现创纪录的年度营业利润，但该公司在过去一年中已裁员 4000 多人。【原文：Berkshire Hathaway said on Friday it has shed more than 4,000 jobs over the last year, even as the conglomerate run by Warren Buffett is on pace to post a record annual operating profit.】

item.title: 尽管承诺降低成本，特朗普关税仍将刺激美国食品通胀
item.description: 经济学家和食品行业高管表示，如果美国总统唐纳德-特朗普对加拿大和墨西哥进口商品征收关税，正在努力应对牛肉和鸡蛋价格飞涨的美国消费者将面临更高的肉类、蔬菜和水果成本。【原文：U.S. consumers grappling with soaring prices for beef and eggs will face even higher costs for meat, vegetables and fruit if President Donald Trump imposes tariffs on Canadian and Mexican imports, economists and food industry executives said.】

item.title: 美国农产品出口/进口受到特朗普贸易行动的威胁
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普正计划对从墨西哥和加拿大进口的商品征收 25% 的关税，并威胁对其他国家的商品征收关税，这引发了进口美国农产品的国家对贸易报复的担忧。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump is planning to impose 25% tariffs on imports from Mexico and Canada and has threatened duties on goods from other nations, sparking concerns of trade retaliation from countries that import U.S. agricultural goods.】

item.title: 华纳兄弟在新电影上映前遭遇超人版权诉讼
item.description: 在华纳兄弟发现公司（Warner Bros. Discovery）的新电影《超人》上映之前，超人的一位联合创作人的遗产向美国法院提起了版权诉讼。【原文：The estate of one of Superman's co-creators has filed a copyright lawsuit in a U.S. court against Warner Bros. Discovery ahead of the release of its new movie "Superman," part of a planned reboot of the DC Comics superhero film franchise.】

item.title: 特朗普将于周六对墨西哥、加拿大和中国征收关税
item.description: 白宫发言人卡罗琳-利维特（Karoline Leavitt）周五表示，美国将对加拿大和墨西哥征收25%的关税，并对中国征收10%的关税，但她拒绝透露是否会有豁免。【原文：The U.S. will impose 25% tariffs on Canada and Mexico, along with 10% on China, White House spokeswoman Karoline Leavitt said on Friday, but she declined to say whether there will be exemptions.】
